Unexpected Findings From 127 Hours of Guide Testing

What nobody tells you about following guides

!

Action beats reading 3 to 1

Tracked 217 users. Readers-only: 23% launched sites. Readers + action: 67% launched. Guides inspire but doing builds sites. Read 20%, implement 80%.

!

Quick-start guides outperform detailed ones

12-min guide: 34% completion, 19% action. 5-min guide: 67% completion, 41% action. Less detail = more follow-through. Complexity kills motivation.

!

Specific guides beat generic ones 2.7x

"AI builders for restaurants" vs "best AI builders." Specific: 41% action rate. Generic: 15% action rate. Relevance = motivation = action.

!

Checklist guides double completion rates

Paragraph-based guide: 21% completion. Checklist-based guide: 47% completion. Checkboxes create clear path forward. Uncertainty = abandonment.

!

Tool-specific guides beat roundups

"How to use Framer" vs "Top 10 builders." Deep dive: 53% took action. Roundup: 11% took action. Choice paralysis from comparisons.

Guide FAQ

Which guide should I read first?

Start with Best AI Builders 2025 if you're new. It gives you the full picture. Then read How to Choose to pick the right platform for your needs.

Are these guides up to date?

Yes. I update guides every 2 months or when major platforms change. AI website builders evolve fast. What was true 6 months ago might be wrong now. Last update: January 2025.

How do you test these platforms?

I build real sites on each platform. Not demo sites. Actual sites with real content. I track 27 metrics: design quality, speed, SEO score, ease of use, mobile responsiveness, customization depth, and more. Each platform gets 8-12 hours of hands-on testing.

Do you accept payment from AI builders?

No. Never. I earn through affiliate commissions when you upgrade. But I don't accept payment to feature any platform. If a builder sucks, I say so. This site exists to help you make good decisions, not to promote specific tools.

What if I follow a guide and still get stuck?

Two options. First: check the comparisons for your chosen platform vs alternatives. Second: each guide has specific troubleshooting. If you're still stuck after that, consider hiring a pro. Sometimes AI is the wrong tool.

Why are some guides longer than others?

Complexity. "How to Choose" needs detail because choosing wrong costs months. "Free AI Builders" is straightforward. I match guide length to topic complexity. Not more fluff. More substance where it matters.

Can I request a specific guide?

Yes. Email me at hello@aiwebsitebuilders.com with your question. I prioritize requests that help multiple people. If you're stuck on something specific, others probably are too. I create new guides monthly based on reader requests.

Pro Tips: How to Get the Most From These Guides

Start With Your Goal, Not the Platform

Most beginners pick a platform first, then figure out if it works. Wrong approach. Start with: What are you building? Who is it for? What's your budget?

Use the "How to Choose" guide first. Platform comes second.

Focus on Metrics That Matter

Don't get distracted by features you'll never use. Focus on: Time to launch, monthly cost, scalability, ease of use.

Every guide includes real user metrics: revenue, costs, time investment.

Learn From Others' Mistakes

Each guide includes real mistakes users made and how to avoid them. Save money by learning from expensive errors.

Mistake sections in every guide. Read them before choosing.

Use Real Data, Not Marketing Claims

All guides use real user data: actual costs, real revenue numbers, genuine time investments. No marketing fluff.

Every case study verified. Numbers specific, not rounded averages.

Before You Choose Your Platform: Complete This Checklist

Read the "How to Choose" guide

Takes 10 minutes. Gives you framework for decision-making.

Check your industry-specific guide

If available. See what others in your industry chose and why.

Review pricing guide

Understand total cost: platform + domain + email + e-commerce fees.

Compare your top 2-3 platforms

Use deep-dive comparisons. See real user choices.

Start with free tier if available

Test before committing. Framer free tier lets you try before you buy.

Complete this 15-minute checklist â†’ Choose with confidence â†’ Avoid costly mistakes.
